    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;

          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;

          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;

    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }

  }

  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.

    font-weight: bold;

 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }

 }
 }
 });

    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;

              <span></span>Issue list<span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    k<kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  
                    j<kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      A preview Page bug that can be exploited by attackers to<span class="line"><!---->A preview Page bug that can be exploited by attackers to<!----></span><br>steal personal data. First discovered on Chrome for Android, via Google search.<span class="line"><!---->steal personal data. First discovered on Chrome for Android, via Google search.<!----></span><br>OS: Android 11version 91.0.4472.120<span class="line"><!---->OS: Android 11version 91.0.4472.120<!----></span><br>Crash ID: 1b1bd41e3b4363e8<span class="line"><!---->Crash ID: 1b1bd41e3b4363e8<!----></span><br>URL where crash occurred:<span class="line"><!---->URL where crash occurred:<!----></span><br>YouTube.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://YouTube.com"><!---->YouTube.com<!----></a><br>Can you reproduce this crash?<span class="line"><!---->Can you reproduce this crash?<!----></span><br>Yes<span class="line"><!---->Yes<!----></span><br>What steps will reproduce this crash (or if it's not reproducible,<span class="line"><!---->What steps will reproduce this crash (or if it's not reproducible,<!----></span><br>what were you doing just before the crash)?<span class="line"><!---->what were you doing just before the crash)?<!----></span><br>(1) Open any YouTube Video on Chrome android through preview Page option, and and click on the share button.<span class="line"><!---->(1) Open any YouTube Video on Chrome android through preview Page option, and and click on the share button.<!----></span><br>(2)This leads to freezing of the Chrome application and subsequent crashing.<span class="line"><!---->(2)This leads to freezing of the Chrome application and subsequent crashing.<!----></span><br>(3) I was watching a YouTube video through Preview Page option.<span class="line"><!---->(3) I was watching a YouTube video through Preview Page option.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

I'm not convinced that it's actually a security vulnerability, but it's definitely memory corruption in the browser process, so I'm conservatively calling it severity-high.<span class="line"><!---->I can reproduce this.           shaktisahu@chromium.org donnd@chromium.org boonsiri@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          shaktisahu@chromium.org donnd@chromium.org boonsiri@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Thanks for reporting the issue.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for reporting the issue.<!----></span><br><br>The crash comes from the missing ShareDelegateSupplier for the ThinWebView's own WindowAndroid [1] ThinWebView cannot take care of this within itself because ShareDelegate/Supplier is not modularized (yet), hence not accessible by ThinWebView component.<span class="line"><!---->The crash comes from the missing ShareDelegateSupplier for the ThinWebView's own WindowAndroid [1] ThinWebView cannot take care of this within itself because ShareDelegate/Supplier is not modularized (yet), hence not accessible by ThinWebView component.<!----></span><br><br>Preview Tab is not aiming to be a container for a fully-featured WebContents (there are other features that work on normal Tab but not on Preview Tab). so I think it would be okay just to avoid the crash and not let the Blink Share feature work. This can be handled by Preview Tab retrieving ThinWebView's WindowAndroid and initialize ShareDelegateSupplier, but not actually setting the ShareDelegate itself. This comes to an effect of disabling the feature. <span class="line"><!---->Preview Tab is not aiming to be a container for a fully-featured WebContents (there are other features that work on normal Tab but not on Preview Tab). so I think it would be okay just to avoid the crash and not let the Blink Share feature work. This can be handled by Preview Tab retrieving ThinWebView's WindowAndroid and initialize ShareDelegateSupplier, but not actually setting the ShareDelegate itself. This comes to an effect of disabling the feature. <!----></span><br><br>donnd@ boonsiri@ WDYT?<span class="line"><!---->donnd@ boonsiri@ WDYT?<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/webshare/ShareServiceImplementationFactory.java;l=28;drc=8fa992872442ca6b3a86ad357d6cec2847e6971a<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/webshare/ShareServiceImplementationFactory.java;l=28;drc=8fa992872442ca6b3a86ad357d6cec2847e6971a"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/webshare/ShareServiceImplementationFactory.java;l=28;drc=8fa992872442ca6b3a86ad357d6cec2847e6971a<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      </div><br>
    
        
      
        This is caused by ThinWebView's WindowAndroid being different from the activity's WindowAndroid, which is logically correct since they use different compositors. However we are using WebContent's UserDataHost to temporarily store a bunch of things which should actually be shared between two WebContents.<span class="line"><!---->This is caused by ThinWebView's WindowAndroid being different from the activity's WindowAndroid, which is logically correct since they use different compositors. However we are using WebContent's UserDataHost to temporarily store a bunch of things which should actually be shared between two WebContents.<!----></span><br><br>A list of all the things that are retrieved through user data of WindowAndroid is here :<span class="line"><!---->A list of all the things that are retrieved through user data of WindowAndroid is here :<!----></span><br>https://source.chromium.org/search?q=retrieveDataFromHost&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/search?q=retrieveDataFromHost&amp;ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/search?q=retrieveDataFromHost&amp;ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc<!----></a><br><br>I wonder in long term if we should have a way to share the UserDataHost between two WindowAndroid.<span class="line"><!---->I wonder in long term if we should have a way to share the UserDataHost between two WindowAndroid.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        Did a quick experiment sharing the ShareDelegateSupplier among main WindowAndroid and ThinWebView's WindowAndroid. That works fine in terms of functionality, but I discovered a UI issue - both Preview Tab and Share are implemented on BottomSheet. The Share UI bottom sheet does not appear until the Preview Tab sheet is dismissed, which makes the feature look very awkward to use [1]. I suggest we leave Share disabled on Preview Tab until this UX can be resolved.<span class="line"><!---->Did a quick experiment sharing the ShareDelegateSupplier among main WindowAndroid and ThinWebView's WindowAndroid. That works fine in terms of functionality, but I discovered a UI issue - both Preview Tab and Share are implemented on BottomSheet. The Share UI bottom sheet does not appear until the Preview Tab sheet is dismissed, which makes the feature look very awkward to use [1]. I suggest we leave Share disabled on Preview Tab until this UX can be resolved.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://drive.google.com/file/d/1HY84enuXP11IqB9S1rsX8L8EfGjF6sfg/view?usp=sharing<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1HY84enuXP11IqB9S1rsX8L8EfGjF6sfg/view?usp=sharing"><!---->https://drive.google.com/file/d/1HY84enuXP11IqB9S1rsX8L8EfGjF6sfg/view?usp=sharing<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8.         Apologies, but the VRP Panel decline to award this report. While memory corruption is a concern, there was no demonstrated exploitability of this issue nor analysis to lead us to believe this is a valid security issue that results in any issue beyond a crash or potential null pointer dereference. <span class="line"><!---->Apologies, but the VRP Panel decline to award this report. While memory corruption is a concern, there was no demonstrated exploitability of this issue nor analysis to lead us to believe this is a valid security issue that results in any issue beyond a crash or potential null pointer dereference. <!----></span><br>If you can provide a demonstration or POC to show how this issue can be exploited, we would happily revisit and reassess accordingly. Thank you.<span class="line"><!---->If you can provide a demonstration or POC to show how this issue can be exploited, we would happily revisit and reassess accordingly. Thank you.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I understand this is disappointing and Memory Corruption is definitely a valid security concern, however, there needs to be shown either analysis, an exploit, or a poc to demonstrate and show this is exploitable by an attacker. There wasn't enough information that there is an exploitable issue to result in memory corruption in your report. Please refer to <span class="line"><!---->I understand this is disappointing and Memory Corruption is definitely a valid security concern, however, there needs to be shown either analysis, an exploit, or a poc to demonstrate and show this is exploitable by an attacker. There wasn't enough information that there is an exploitable issue to result in memory corruption in your report. Please refer to <!----></span>https://www.google.com/about/appsecurity/chrome-rewards/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.google.com/about/appsecurity/chrome-rewards/"><!---->https://www.google.com/about/appsecurity/chrome-rewards/<!----></a> for more information as well as examples of rewardable security reports. <span class="line"><!----> for more information as well as examples of rewardable security reports. <!----></span><br><br>Also, our [Security FAQ] (<span class="line"><!---->Also, our [Security FAQ] (<!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/docs/security/faq.md<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/docs/security/faq.md"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/docs/security/faq.md<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> provides some more information of what we consider to be valid and rewardable reports and what issues we don't consider to be rewardable, such as null pointer derefs. <span class="line"><!----> provides some more information of what we consider to be valid and rewardable reports and what issues we don't consider to be rewardable, such as null pointer derefs. <!----></span><br><br>As I mentioned above, if you can provide analysis or demonstrate how this issue could be exploited and result in memory corruptions, we would very happily revisit and reassess. Thank you.<span class="line"><!---->As I mentioned above, if you can provide analysis or demonstrate how this issue could be exploited and result in memory corruptions, we would very happily revisit and reassess. Thank you.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

           * there's spacing. */

          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;

          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

                  <!---->:
                </span>
                compose a new issue<span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              
                
                  
                    s<kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>

                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                star the current issue<span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>

                     / <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>

                <span class="key-shortcut">

                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

            Issue 1229516: Security: WebShare from ephemeral tab triggers browser crash
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1229516: Security: WebShare from ephemeral tab triggers browser crash
          </h1>
          
            Reported by

      A preview Page bug that can be exploited by attackers to<span class="line"><!---->A preview Page bug that can be exploited by attackers to<!----></span><br>steal personal data. First discovered on Chrome for Android, via Google search.<span class="line"><!---->steal personal data. First discovered on Chrome for Android, via Google search.<!----></span><br>OS: Android 11version 91.0.4472.120<span class="line"><!---->OS: Android 11version 91.0.4472.120<!----></span><br>Crash ID: 1b1bd41e3b4363e8<span class="line"><!---->Crash ID: 1b1bd41e3b4363e8<!----></span><br>URL where crash occurred:<span class="line"><!---->URL where crash occurred:<!----></span><br>YouTube.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://YouTube.com"><!---->YouTube.com<!----></a><br>Can you reproduce this crash?<span class="line"><!---->Can you reproduce this crash?<!----></span><br>Yes<span class="line"><!---->Yes<!----></span><br>What steps will reproduce this crash (or if it's not reproducible,<span class="line"><!---->What steps will reproduce this crash (or if it's not reproducible,<!----></span><br>what were you doing just before the crash)?<span class="line"><!---->what were you doing just before the crash)?<!----></span><br>(1) Open any YouTube Video on Chrome android through preview Page option, and and click on the share button.<span class="line"><!---->(1) Open any YouTube Video on Chrome android through preview Page option, and and click on the share button.<!----></span><br>(2)This leads to freezing of the Chrome application and subsequent crashing.<span class="line"><!---->(2)This leads to freezing of the Chrome application and subsequent crashing.<!----></span><br>(3) I was watching a YouTube video through Preview Page option.<span class="line"><!---->(3) I was watching a YouTube video through Preview Page option.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          shaktisahu@chromium.org donnd@chromium.org boonsiri@chromium.org

      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          shaktisahu@chromium.org donnd@chromium.org boonsiri@chromium.org

      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Thanks for reporting the issue.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for reporting the issue.<!----></span><br><br>The crash comes from the missing ShareDelegateSupplier for the ThinWebView's own WindowAndroid [1] ThinWebView cannot take care of this within itself because ShareDelegate/Supplier is not modularized (yet), hence not accessible by ThinWebView component.<span class="line"><!---->The crash comes from the missing ShareDelegateSupplier for the ThinWebView's own WindowAndroid [1] ThinWebView cannot take care of this within itself because ShareDelegate/Supplier is not modularized (yet), hence not accessible by ThinWebView component.<!----></span><br><br>Preview Tab is not aiming to be a container for a fully-featured WebContents (there are other features that work on normal Tab but not on Preview Tab). so I think it would be okay just to avoid the crash and not let the Blink Share feature work. This can be handled by Preview Tab retrieving ThinWebView's WindowAndroid and initialize ShareDelegateSupplier, but not actually setting the ShareDelegate itself. This comes to an effect of disabling the feature. <span class="line"><!---->Preview Tab is not aiming to be a container for a fully-featured WebContents (there are other features that work on normal Tab but not on Preview Tab). so I think it would be okay just to avoid the crash and not let the Blink Share feature work. This can be handled by Preview Tab retrieving ThinWebView's WindowAndroid and initialize ShareDelegateSupplier, but not actually setting the ShareDelegate itself. This comes to an effect of disabling the feature. <!----></span><br><br>donnd@ boonsiri@ WDYT?<span class="line"><!---->donnd@ boonsiri@ WDYT?<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/webshare/ShareServiceImplementationFactory.java;l=28;drc=8fa992872442ca6b3a86ad357d6cec2847e6971a<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/webshare/ShareServiceImplementationFactory.java;l=28;drc=8fa992872442ca6b3a86ad357d6cec2847e6971a"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/webshare/ShareServiceImplementationFactory.java;l=28;drc=8fa992872442ca6b3a86ad357d6cec2847e6971a<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Jul 15, 2021, 8:53 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

          Cc:<strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          dtrainor@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Cc:</strong>
          
          dtrainor@chromium.org
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        This is caused by ThinWebView's WindowAndroid being different from the activity's WindowAndroid, which is logically correct since they use different compositors. However we are using WebContent's UserDataHost to temporarily store a bunch of things which should actually be shared between two WebContents.<span class="line"><!---->This is caused by ThinWebView's WindowAndroid being different from the activity's WindowAndroid, which is logically correct since they use different compositors. However we are using WebContent's UserDataHost to temporarily store a bunch of things which should actually be shared between two WebContents.<!----></span><br><br>A list of all the things that are retrieved through user data of WindowAndroid is here :<span class="line"><!---->A list of all the things that are retrieved through user data of WindowAndroid is here :<!----></span><br>https://source.chromium.org/search?q=retrieveDataFromHost&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://source.chromium.org/search?q=retrieveDataFromHost&amp;ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc"><!---->https://source.chromium.org/search?q=retrieveDataFromHost&amp;ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc<!----></a><br><br>I wonder in long term if we should have a way to share the UserDataHost between two WindowAndroid.<span class="line"><!---->I wonder in long term if we should have a way to share the UserDataHost between two WindowAndroid.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1229516#c8">Comment 8<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Jul 15, 2021, 9:46 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1229516#c8">Comment 8<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Jul 15, 2021, 9:46 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Did a quick experiment sharing the ShareDelegateSupplier among main WindowAndroid and ThinWebView's WindowAndroid. That works fine in terms of functionality, but I discovered a UI issue - both Preview Tab and Share are implemented on BottomSheet. The Share UI bottom sheet does not appear until the Preview Tab sheet is dismissed, which makes the feature look very awkward to use [1]. I suggest we leave Share disabled on Preview Tab until this UX can be resolved.<span class="line"><!---->Did a quick experiment sharing the ShareDelegateSupplier among main WindowAndroid and ThinWebView's WindowAndroid. That works fine in terms of functionality, but I discovered a UI issue - both Preview Tab and Share are implemented on BottomSheet. The Share UI bottom sheet does not appear until the Preview Tab sheet is dismissed, which makes the feature look very awkward to use [1]. I suggest we leave Share disabled on Preview Tab until this UX can be resolved.<!----></span><br><br>[1] <span class="line"><!---->[1] <!----></span>https://drive.google.com/file/d/1HY84enuXP11IqB9S1rsX8L8EfGjF6sfg/view?usp=sharing<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://drive.google.com/file/d/1HY84enuXP11IqB9S1rsX8L8EfGjF6sfg/view?usp=sharing"><!---->https://drive.google.com/file/d/1HY84enuXP11IqB9S1rsX8L8EfGjF6sfg/view?usp=sharing<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f1f959054a553a535498c39d365b47e19afdf3eb<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f1f959054a553a535498c39d365b47e19afdf3eb"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/f1f959054a553a535498c39d365b47e19afdf3eb<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>f1f959054a553a535498c39d365b47e19afdf3eb<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/f1f959054a553a535498c39d365b47e19afdf3eb"><!---->f1f959054a553a535498c39d365b47e19afdf3eb<!----></a><br>Author: Jinsuk Kim <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Jinsuk Kim &lt;<!----></span>jinsukkim@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/jinsukkim@chromium.org"><!---->jinsukkim@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Jul 21 22:32:15 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Jul 21 22:32:15 2021<!----></span><br><br>PreviewTab: Disable Web Share feature and fix the crash<span class="line"><!---->PreviewTab: Disable Web Share feature and fix the crash<!----></span><br><br>ThinWebView backing PreviewTab manages its own WindowAndroid but<span class="line"><!---->ThinWebView backing PreviewTab manages its own WindowAndroid but<!----></span><br>its ShareDelegate/Supplier was not set. It caused the reported crash.<span class="line"><!---->its ShareDelegate/Supplier was not set. It caused the reported crash.<!----></span><br>This CL initializes the supplier but not set the Delegate object,<span class="line"><!---->This CL initializes the supplier but not set the Delegate object,<!----></span><br>in order to fix the crash but leave the feature disabled on Preview Tab.<span class="line"><!---->in order to fix the crash but leave the feature disabled on Preview Tab.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1229516<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1229516" title="Security: WebShare from ephemeral tab triggers browser crash"><!---->Bug: 1229516<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I355ae0e602988e8044bc6a7bf08ab51633345b86<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id:         This bug requires manual review: Request affecting a post-stable build<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: Request affecting a post-stable build<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7.         Apologies, but the VRP Panel decline to award this report. While memory corruption is a concern, there was no demonstrated exploitability of this issue nor analysis to lead us to believe this is a valid security issue that results in any issue beyond a crash or potential null pointer dereference. <span class="line"><!---->Apologies, but the VRP Panel decline to award this report. While memory corruption is a concern, there was no demonstrated exploitability of this issue nor analysis to lead us to believe this is a valid security issue that results in any issue beyond a crash or potential null pointer dereference. <!----></span><br>If you can provide a demonstration or POC to show how this issue can be exploited, we would happily revisit and reassess accordingly. Thank you.<span class="line"><!---->If you can provide a demonstration or POC to show how this issue can be exploited, we would happily revisit and reassess accordingly. Thank you.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I understand this is disappointing and Memory Corruption is definitely a valid security concern, however, there needs to be shown either analysis, an exploit, or a poc to demonstrate and show this is exploitable by an attacker. There wasn't enough information that there is an exploitable issue to result in memory corruption in your report. Please refer to <span class="line"><!---->I understand this is disappointing and Memory Corruption is definitely a valid security concern, however, there needs to be shown either analysis, an exploit, or a poc to demonstrate and show this is exploitable by an attacker. There wasn't enough information that there is an exploitable issue to result in memory corruption in your report. Please refer to <!----></span>https://www.google.com/about/appsecurity/chrome-rewards/<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.google.com/about/appsecurity/chrome-rewards/"><!---->https://www.google.com/about/appsecurity/chrome-rewards/<!----></a> for more information as well as examples of rewardable security reports. <span class="line"><!----> for more information as well as examples of rewardable security reports. <!----></span><br><br>Also, our [Security FAQ] (<span class="line"><!---->Also, our [Security FAQ] (<!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/docs/security/faq.md<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/docs/security/faq.md"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/docs/security/faq.md<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> provides some more information of what we consider to be valid and rewardable reports and what issues we don't consider to be rewardable, such as null pointer derefs. <span class="line"><!----> provides some more information of what we consider to be valid and rewardable reports and what issues we don't consider to be rewardable, such as null pointer derefs. <!----></span><br><br>As I mentioned above, if you can provide analysis or demonstrate how this issue could be exploited and result in memory corruptions, we would very happily revisit and reassess. Thank you.<span class="line"><!---->As I mentioned above, if you can provide analysis or demonstrate how this issue could be exploited and result in memory corruptions, we would very happily revisit and reassess. Thank you.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

          

          <div class="edit-actions">
            <chops-button class="de-emphasized">
              Cancel
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button class="emphasized">
               issue
            </chops-button>
          </div>
        </div>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;

          <mr-error hidden="">

          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;

          margin: auto;

          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

      A preview Page bug that can be exploited by attackers to<span class="line"><!---->A preview Page bug that can be exploited by attackers to<!----></span><br>steal personal data. First discovered on Chrome for Android, via Google search.<span class="line"><!---->steal personal data. First discovered on Chrome for Android, via Google search.<!----></span><br>OS: Android 11version 91.0.4472.120<span class="line"><!---->OS: Android 11version 91.0.4472.120<!----></span><br>Crash ID: 1b1bd41e3b4363e8<span class="line"><!---->Crash ID: 1b1bd41e3b4363e8<!----></span><br>URL where crash occurred:<span class="line"><!---->URL where crash occurred:<!----></span><br>YouTube.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://YouTube.com"><!---->YouTube.com<!----></a><br>Can you reproduce this crash?<span class="line"><!---->Can you reproduce this crash?<!----></span><br>Yes<span class="line"><!---->Yes<!----></span><br>What steps will reproduce this crash (or if it's not reproducible,<span class="line"><!---->What steps will reproduce this crash (or if it's not reproducible,<!----></span><br>what were you doing just before the crash)?<span class="line"><!---->what were you doing just before the crash)?<!----></span><br>(1) Open any YouTube Video on Chrome android through preview Page option, and and click on the share button.<span class="line"><!---->(1) Open any YouTube Video on Chrome android through preview Page option, and and click on the share button.<!----></span><br>(2)This leads to freezing of the Chrome application and subsequent crashing.<span class="line"><!---->(2)This leads to freezing of the Chrome application and subsequent crashing.<!----></span><br>(3) I was watching a YouTube video through Preview Page option.<span class="line"><!---->(3) I was watching a YouTube video through Preview Page option.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I can reproduce this. I'm not convinced that it's actually a security vulnerability, but it's definitely memory corruption in the browser process, so I'm conservatively calling it severity-high.<span class="line"><!---->I can reproduce this. I'm not convinced that it's actually a security vulnerability, but it's definitely memory corruption in the browser process, so I'm conservatively calling it severity-high.<!----></span><br><br>jinsukkim@: can you please take a look? If you're not the right person for this, can you help me re-route it? Thanks!<span class="line"><!---->jinsukkim@: can you please take a look? If you're not the right person for this, can you help me re-route it? Thanks!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 3<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1229516#c3">Comment 3<!----></a>

          shaktisahu@chromium.org donnd@chromium.org boonsiri@chromium.org
